etymologies: mid 19th century. From German Psorosperm from ancient Greek ψώρα + σπέρμα seed

definitions: Any of various unicellular parasites found in an encysted stage in the tissues of a host; (also) any of the organisms which form such cysts, now variously identified as sporozoans (especially coccidia and gregarines), microsporidians, and myxosporidians.
